data.text:
Excited to host a Ventuals trading competition in partnership with @BasedOneX 

- Jan 8 - 22
- Up to $25,000 in prizes
- Top 10 PnL winners get cash

Begins Jan 8th at 12pm UTC https://t.co/KhpCt0SN3c
For full details, please see our documentation: https://t.co/kgv9R6W6r7

During internal oracle pricing sessions (e.g. weekends and holidays), a dynamic adjustment factor will be applied.

This increases market manipulation resistance during non-normal trading hours.

There are no changes to oracle pricing when external feeds are available.

Public equity basket internal oracle and funding rate parameters will be updated at 3pm ET today.

These changes apply only to public baskets, e.g. MAG7, SEMIS, ROBOT, INFOTECH.

There are no changes to market parameters for pre-IPO markets.

The funding rate multiplier will be changed from 1.0 → 0.5, resulting in a baseline funding rate of ~5.5% annualized.

This brings borrow costs closer to industry standards for traditional asset classes.

data.text: If you see your wallet on this list, please DM @alvinhsia – we'd like to invite you to our VIP trader program. https://t.co/STPJA468PP

Funding rates:

There will be 3 distinct "states" for pre-IPO funding rates, based on the average mark-to-oracle deviation.

Low: <5%
Medium: 5-19%
High: 19%+

This incentivizes traders to step in before the 20% mark-to-oracle price bound is hit. https://t.co/BAhS7VA6in

The oracle change narrows the achievable mark price band, so holding short positions with a liquidation price outside of the mark price band is more capital efficient.

Before: [0.5x, 3x] relative to Notice
After: [4/7x, 2x] relative to Notice https://t.co/eQT0vw0HfO

Upcoming update to Ventuals pre-IPO market parameters, based on community feedback.

These changes will make funding more predictable, and holding short positions more capital efficient.

Updates go live on Thu, Dec 18 at 3pm ET. https://t.co/YUtS6Ieiiv

Oracle definition:

Before: 1/4 * Notice + 3/4 * 2hr mark EMA
After: 1/3 * Notice + 2/3 * 2hr mark EMA https://t.co/qrZNMKL88R

Scheduled market parameter changes have been made:

1. More responsive oracle
2. Expanded mark price bands
3. Dynamic funding rates

These changes will facilitate more natural price discovery on Ventuals markets going forward. https://t.co/IVxurAjPBa

For more information on why we've made these changes, see this thread:
https://t.co/3wzLxX0Faa
Please read the quoted thread and see our docs for full details https://t.co/vL5p5gDhNj

To give market participants ample time to adjust to these parameters, these changes will take effect on Tuesday, Dec 2nd at 3pm ET.

Thank you to our community for the feedback, and for venturing into the frontier with us.

Upcoming changes to Ventuals market parameters:

These updates will facilitate more natural price discovery, and result in fewer instances of orders being limited by price band guardrails. https://t.co/s9SwcZT39m

See our docs for full details on Ventuals funding rates

https://t.co/3LUDbFUeD6

This is the first step to reduce instances of mark price bands being hit on pre-IPO perp markets

https://t.co/VaGCL0qyrF
In a future update, the funding multiplier will be made dynamic based on the difference between the mark price and oracle price.

Funding rate multipliers for SpaceX, OpenAI, and Anthropic have been increased from 0.002 to 0.005.

This increases the funding payments paid by longs to shorts when the perp mark price is greater than the oracle price, and vice versa.

Pre-IPO company perps are novel markets.

It’s been exciting to see how traders have been interacting with these markets in the 2 weeks since our mainnet alpha launch.

We’re working hard to bring these new markets to life in a safe manner for all participants.

Thank you to the
You can read the full details on Ventuals mark price bands here https://t.co/N17WUoRfZm

What’s the solution?

Short term:

We will be adjusting the funding rate when the mark-to-oracle deviation is close to its limit, to make it more costly for longs to be held, and more attractive for shorts to be opened.

Medium-long term:

Overall, the main thing to improve here

The good

While frustrating, the mark price bounds actually protected short traders this week.

Many shorts would have gotten flash liquidated if these bounds were not in place. Moreover, because the mark is at the upper bound of the oracle price, short position holders’

The bad

Several Ventuals markets hit their upper price bound this week.

Until new asks came in lower than the upper bound, users were not able to market close shorts. In this scenario, they needed to submit limit orders within the price band.

We recognize this is a frustrating

These constraints protect against price manipulation during periods of thin liquidity.

And specifically for Ventuals markets, they ensure price discovery stays within reasonable bands relative to what secondaries and official fundraises are priced at.

However, they also created https://t.co/bKIJpyG4rK

All HIP-3 markets must specify an externalPerpPx, and the Hyperliquid system prevents orders from being executed (1 / max leverage) away from this price, which is additionally capped at ±20%.

Like other HIP-3 deployers, Ventuals uses the market’s oracle price as the

An explanation of Ventuals mark price bands:

- Why HIP-3 mark price bounds exist and how Ventuals uses them

- What happened this week when several markets hit their upper bound

- How this impacted trader experience (the bad)

- How the bounds actually protected short traders https://t.co/7hj8iG7HVF

Traditional private markets are not easy to access:

- Accredited investor requirements: over $1M in net worth or high annual income
- High minimum ticket sizes + management and performance fees
- Opaque and illiquid secondary markets with predatory transaction costs
- Access

Ventuals matches public interest in transformative technology with real, tradable markets.

Today, only a privileged few get access to the most innovative companies in the world.

At Ventuals, we believe that end users who actually see and feel a company’s products and growth

The venture capital industry has grown more than 25x over the last two decades, from ~$140 billion in the early 2000s to over $3 trillion today.

Over the same period, the number of public companies in the U.S. has dropped by a third.

Technology is the biggest driver of growth https://t.co/zV8eBwj6RE

Companies used to go public much earlier, allowing anyone to participate in their upside.

Today, startups stay private for longer than ever.

Normal people can buy lottery tickets and memecoins, but can’t get exposure to the most transformative companies in the world.

Ventuals

Maker points will start once the first Ventuals market begins trading on mainnet (soon).

Start your engines.

Read more here: https://t.co/JEUZxvOypO

The number of weekly maker points and the weighting between these factors may change week to week, depending on liquidity dynamics and needs.

Anti-gaming measures will be considered to ensure that points distribution is tied to genuine market-making behavior.

The exact distribution methodology will not be disclosed, but includes these factors:

- Size & proximity: how much liquidity a maker posts and how close those orders are to top of book

- Uptime: how continuously a maker provides resting quotes throughout the week

-

Introducing Ventuals Maker Points

A program to incentivize healthy liquidity on Ventuals markets:

- 200,000 points allocated each week to start
- Any wallet address that provides maker liquidity (limit orders) on Ventuals markets is eligible https://t.co/z7NJdgCiqK

OpenAI’s valuation has gone up by more than 7x over the last 2 years.

Their employees recently had the opportunity to privately sell shares at a $500B valuation.

Now, rumors are they’ll IPO in 2027 at $1 trillion.

But the public still can’t get in.

Well, we’re not waiting
Ventuals matches the public interest in transformative technology with real, tradable markets.

We believe that 24/7 open markets value companies better and faster than VCs behind closed doors.

End users who see and feel a company’s growth should be able to get exposure to it.

That's why we're Making Private Markets Public.

The total market cap of private technology companies is estimated to be $3-5 trillion.

If they were a country, it would be one of the top 5 largest equity markets in the world.

From AI to space tech to robotics, these companies are pushing new frontiers and transforming the https://t.co/JKlimJ1ACk

data.text:
Multiplier Boosts

Each adds +1x to your tier multiplier:

- Testnet active trader

- VLP depositor

- Hypurr NFT holder

Example: Tier 1 (10x) + VLP + Hypurr = 12x

Boosts apply only if your vHYPE is held in the qualifying wallet.

DeFi Protocols

Depositing vHYPE into DeFi protocols counts as a transfer, but you can continue to earn Ventuals points at the lowest available tier.

We’ve partnered with @pendle_fi, @prjx_hl, and @ultrasolid_hl to track the vHYPE you have deposited into these protocols.

Transfers

Transferring vHYPE bumps it down to the lowest available tier.

If you’re Tier 1 and move funds while total deposits = 750K HYPE, you’ll land in Tier 4.

Move wisely.

Withdrawals

Withdrawals are applied last-in-first-out (LIFO).

Your most recent deposits are withdrawn first, to retain your highest possible multiplier tier.

Queued withdrawals still earn native yield, but no points.

Tier Bumps

When someone withdraws, others move up.

Example: 10K HYPE leaves Tier 1 → the earliest 10K in Tier 2 move up.

Early and steady positions get rewarded.
Deposit Tiers and Multipliers https://t.co/NaAVZxFdFO

How it works

Every hour you hold 1 HYPE staked = 1 stake-hour.

At the end of each week:

- All stake-hours are added up

- Tiers and boosts apply multipliers

- Points are distributed proportionally

Earlier, longer, and boosts = more points

Emissions

- 5M points in Week 1

- 1M points each week after

You just need to hold vHYPE, the LST for Ventuals.

Timeline

- First points snapshot Thu, Oct 23 15:00 UTC

- Snapshots → every Thursday

- Distributions → every Friday

The first Ventuals points are dropping this week. 

On Friday Oct 24, 5M points will be distributed.

Then, 1M points per week moving forward.

Here’s how it works: https://t.co/jRQM1hvxZA

The Ventuals story so far.

Mainnet ahead. https://t.co/QRqNYv4hrD

It’s time to tell you where our name and logo come from.

“Ventuals” is a play on words, combining venture, perpetual, and event.

It’s about taking risks, exploring new frontiers, and building what’s next.

The ship is a nod to the roots of “adventure capital”, when explorers https://t.co/kw2Gi4CeKW

The mission was clear: Make Private Markets Public. 

Now, the community that believed isn’t just watching, it’s helping build what comes next. https://t.co/Z08lI1awI2

Deposit and track vHYPE here:
https://t.co/z6eLefTeow

Deposit Tiers (Multipliers)

How it works:

At the end of the week:

- Your total stake-hours are calculated

- Multipliers and boosts are applied

- Points are

The earlier you join, the more you earn. And if someone exits, your position

Here’s how it works:

- Deposit HYPE → you stake HYPE with Ventuals.
- Receive vHYPE → a liquid staking token that represents your HYPE.
- Earn along the way → while holding vHYPE, you automatically:

1. Earn native HYPE staking yield
2. Earn Ventuals Points, distributed

Ventuals is enabled by HIP-3, Hyperliquid’s system for builder-deployed perpetuals.

It enables projects like Ventuals to launch their own perp markets, and requires 500K HYPE staked to ensure quality and security.

What could have been just a technical requirement to enable
